title: Ticket #2985: Detect linker errors on process startup
description:
With the introduction of more aggressive dynamic linking, it's possible to execve a condor binary that can't launch due to dynamic linker errors (wrong version of libcondor_utils).

In such a case, POSIX (http://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/009695399/functions/posix_spawn.html) appears to reserve the exit code 127.

I've seen at least two developers spend hours (one was me!) tracking down issues eventually due to having the wrong library in $LD_LIBRARY_PATH. I've not seen any user hit this, luckily.

I suggest we have special logic to log this case in BIG BOLD LETTERS
remarks:
2012-May-11 07:45:41 by tstclair:
We should version the utils library similar to classads.

2012-May-11 07:52:32 by bbockelm:
Hi Tim,

Well - I lost the battle for keeping (what I consider) proper shared lib versioning for libcondor_utils. We now do:

libcondor_utils_7_9_0.so

(huh - I just noticed that we don't do the normal .so / .so.0 / .so.0.0.0 setup)

However, this ticket is tackling the edge cases of folks dropping binaries in place that don't belong.

For example, I set 

DEV_CONDOR = /home/cse496/bbockelm/projects/condor
SCHEDD = $(DEV_CONDOR)/src/condor_schedd.V6/condor_schedd

and sometimes the resulting schedd doesn't link correctly to the system library.

I think it's pretty rare - and strongly discouraged - for users to do something like this. It's a piece of developer silliness, but a piece of silliness that has cost real time.

Brian
